title: bookmarks_show command with free_layout plugin not enabled sends AttributeError to console

sentences.text: The latest bookmarks.py plugin trips up on the case  free_layout.py plugin not-enabled .
reading settings in /home/bob/bzrWork/pluginPath/leo/config/leoSettings.leo reading settings in /home/bob/.leo/myLeoSettings.leo
These kinds of glitches in plugins typically have low priority, especially for EKR.
This seems to have been fixed.
Furthermore, free_layout will almost always be enabled.

When I disabled all plugins except bookmarks.py and ran Alt-x, bookmarks_show in an outline containing several "bookmarks", it created a new Log-pane tab with label "@url file:" but it left the log tab on top, and it output many error messages to the console:
reading settings in /home/bob/bzr/LeoLatest/leo/config/leoSettings.leo reading settings in /home/bob/.leo/myLeoSettings.leo
The new "@url file:" tab was empty.
reading settings in /home/bob/bzr/LeoLatest/leo/config/leoSettings.leo reading settings in /home/bob/.leo/myLeoSettings.leo
On Sat, Mar 10, 2012 at 6:07 PM, SegundoBob <email address hidden> wrote:
> When I disabled all plugins except bookmarks.py and ran Alt-x,

> bookmarks_show in an outline containing several "bookmarks", it created > a new Log-pane tab with label "@url file:" but it left the log tab on > top, and it output many error messages to the console:
Rev 5143 fixes several issues with the bookmarks.py plugin.
I am not entirely sure that the new code works as the Terry would want, but it does work without crashing on both Python 2.x and 3.x.
Also, the plugin automatically loads free_layout.py if necessary.
> it does work without crashing on both Python 2.x and 3.x.
But I'm still seeing the same errors as reported on
2012-03-10 on the console, with one new message:
When I disabled all plugins except bookmarks.py and ran Alt-x,
bookmarks_show in an outline containing several "bookmarks", it created a new Log-pane tab with label "@url file:" but it left the log tab on top, and it output many error messages to the console:
reading settings in /home/bob/bzr/LeoLatest/leo/config/leoSettings.leo reading settings in /home/bob/.leo/myLeoSettings.leo
The new "@url file:" tab was empty.
reading settings in /home/bob/bzr/LeoLatest/leo/config/leoSettings.leo reading settings in /home/bob/.leo/myLeoSettings.leo
On Thu, Mar 15, 2012 at 1:31 PM, SegundoBob <email address hidden> wrote:
Fixed for good, I think, at rev 5147.
the load of the free_layout plugin in the 'after-create-leo-frame' event handler.
This allows the rest of the code to assume that both c.free_layout and c.free_layout.get_top_splitter exist.
> On Thu, Mar 15, 2012 at 1:31 PM, SegundoBob <email address hidden> wrote:
> Fixed for good, I think, at rev 5147.
> the load of the free_layout plugin in the 'after-create-leo-frame' > event handler.
This allows the rest of the code to assume that both > c.free_layout and c.free_layout.get_top_splitter exist.
I confirm that now there are no error messages sent to the console or to the log pane.
You have probably done all you can.
But I think Terry North needs to make some changes to make it do what he wants and what is reasonable in corner cases.
When the currently selected node is not in an @bookmarks subtree, bookmarks_show seems to do nothing.
When the currently selected node was in an @bookmarks subtree, I got the "bookmarks" sub-window in the body pane, not the Log pane.
reading settings in /home/bob/bzr/LeoLatest/leo/config/leoSettings.leo reading settings in /home/bob/.leo/myLeoSettings.leo
On Thu, Mar 15, 2012 at 6:31 PM, SegundoBob <email address hidden> wrote:
> I confirm that now there are no error messages sent to the console or to > the log pane.
You have probably done all you can.
> But I think Terry North needs to make some changes to make it do what he > wants and what is reasonable in corner cases.
I'd rather not do any more work on this plugin.
